title.narrative: QUALITY EDUCATION

description.narrative: 1.1.1 By 2017, an enhanced education system resulted in an increased number of children and adolescents living in regions with the greatest social/education inequities that complete primary and secondary within the standard timeframes., which contributes to Early Learning, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 1.1 By 2017, children will have greater access to pertinent and quality education and integrated early childhood development care leading to a reduction of social disparities and inequalities.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 1.1.1 By 2017, an enhanced education system resulted in an increased number of children and adolescents living in regions with thegreatest social/education inequities that complete primary and secondary within the standard timeframes.

description.narrative: Facilitated access to best practices for reducing school exclusion. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:09/01/2018

title.narrative: Indicator 1.1.1.2: First grade and seventh grade completion percentage rates in areas of greatest social exclusion for day-time schooling, disaggregated by gender, region and area (urban/rural).
Education sector analysis, financial simulation model or medium term expenditure framework developed with UNICEF support

baseline.value: Develop an analysis of school exclusion supported by UNICEF

target.value: 2017:Implemented the recommendations of the analysis of exclusion

actual.value: 2018:The UNICEF supports the development of a strategy to combat school exclusion Yo me apunto

title.narrative: Education sector analysis, financial simulation model or medium term expenditure framework developed with UNICEF support

baseline.value: Develop an analysis of school exclusion supported by UNICEF

target.value: 2017:Implemented the recommendations of the analysis of exclusion

actual.value: 2018:Yo me apunto strategy includes recommendations of the analysis of exclusion

title.narrative: Indicator 1.1.1.5: National percentage rate for transition from primary to secondary school.

baseline.value: During the 2009 school year, 100% of all enrolled seventh grade students were in sixth grade during 2008. (Transition rate from sixth to seventh grade in 2009 was 1.003).

target.value: 2017:By 2017, a system that permits follow up of students that transition from sixth to seventh grade, reporting transition percentage rates per student.

title.narrative: Indicator 1.1.1.3: The Ministry of Public Education (MEP) will have approved and implemented a strategy to curtail first grade repetition rates.

baseline.value: In 2011, approximately 11.3% of students repeated first grade.

target.value: 2013:A strategy by 2013 to curtail first grade repetition rates.

actual.value: 2017:First grade repetition reform approved by the Higher Education Council, the goal is to start the implementation since 2014. In 2017, the attendance of children in pre-school education became mandatory.

title.narrative: Indicator 1.1.1.4: Repetition percentage rate for seventh grade in areas of greatest social exclusion disaggregated by gender, region y area (urban/rural).

baseline.value: In 2012, 15.2% of seventh grade students repeated their school-year.

target.value: 2017:A five percentage point decrease in seventh grade repetition percentage rates, by 2017.

title.narrative: Indicator 1.1.1.6: Percentage of professors from the Ministry of Public Education Regional Offices of Sula, Limon y Turrialba trained in intercultural education.

target.value: 2017:By 2017, 100% of the professors of the Regional Offices of Sula, Limon y Turrialba have received intercultural education training.

title.narrative: Indicator 1.1.1.1: Primary and secondary school dropout rates in areas of greatest social exclusion, disaggregated by gender, region and area (urban/rural).

baseline.value: Total: 10,2%, Male: 11.6%, Female: 8.9% (MEP, 2010), Urban Areas 9.2%, Rural: 12.1%.
